    Curriculum Vitae

    The Parish

    Audio Engineer

    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.     Select Work Experience

    In The Air Music

    2007 - Present

    Freelance Audio Engineer

    A regular at quintessential Manhattan (Le Poisson Rouge, S.I.R. NYC) and Austin (Scoot Inn, North Door) venues, I've also worked on albums, film sets, radio shows, and corporate events. I'm comfortable with all consoles and have experienced first-hand the stress of South by Southwest, CMJ Music Marathon, and Fun Fun Fun Fest.

    www.intheairmusic.com

    First Unitarian Universalist

    2013 - 2014

    Chief Audio Engineer

    Besides regularly running services and special events, recording podcasts, and mixing for public television, I was in charge of all upgrades, equipment maintenance, booking engineers, and (with the Tech Director) overseeing volunteers.

    www.austinuu.org

    The Parish

    2012 - 2014

    Audio Engineer

    Dubbed "The Best Sound in Town", The Parish is where I really cut my teeth as an engineer. I was first on-call and third in-charge of this official SxSW venue and I worked innumerable concerts, special occasions, and corporate events.

    www.theparishaustin.com

    Volunteer Work and Internship

    KOOP Radio

    2012 - 2013

    Tech Team Volunteer

    The Tech Team at KOOP is in charge of keeping the technical equipment maintained and the programming on the air. We were in charge of the servers and workstations, repaired audio equipment when needed, and made sure the station was in compliance with FCC regulations.

    www.koop.org

    The Parish

    2012

    Audio Engineering Intern

    My internship at The Parish taught me the subtle art of managing creatives in our daily work with musicians. Besides mitigating the chaos surrounding all musicians, I also honed my skills as an audio engineer.

    www.theparishaustin.com

    Robert E. Lee Theater

    2003 - 2006

    Head Lighting Designer

    For plays, events, and showcases, I was the primary student lighting designer, occasionally filled in as an audio engineer, and gained an understanding of theater and event production.

    www.rel.tylerisd.org

    Education

    Austin Community College

    Class of 2012

    AAS in Audio Engineering

    Earned an associates degree in Music Business, Performance, and Technology (Magna Cum Laude) while studying audio engineering. Though I specialized in music recording and reenforcement, I also studied music business, production, event management, and audio for radio, television, and film.

    www.austincc.edu

    Tyler Junior College

    Class of 2010

    AAS in Business Management

    Earned an associates degree in Business Management (Magna Cum Laude) and also a certificate of proficiency in Bookkeeping. Took additional classes in Sound Design.

    www.tjc.edu
